title: Collaborative E-Learning Strategy Development for Understanding Cultural Differences in Online Collaborative Learning

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical concepts and fundamental proficiency in online learning tools
context.additional_context: Students learn in a limited smartphone-centric technological environment and are assessed on collaborative skills through project-based evaluation. The program emphasizes facilitating interaction among learners from diverse cultural backgrounds.

learning_goals: Learners can complete a math problem-solving project within two weeks using online collaboration tools (smartphone app-based).
Learners can explain three or more impacts of cultural differences (e.g., Western Europe vs. East Asia) on online collaboration methods.
Learners can apply social constructivist learning strategies (e.g., peer feedback, knowledge sharing) in a collaborative e-learning environment with over 80% participation.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
